title: ZettelTweet
description: A modern note-taking application that combines the Zettelkasten method with a Twitter-like interface for organizing and connecting thoughts.

fullDescription.content: ZettelTweet is a modern note-taking application that combines the structured methodology of Zettelkasten with the familiar, stream-based interface of Twitter. It provides a unique way to capture, organize, and connect thoughts in a non-linear fashion.

items.title: Timeline View
items.content: Chronological display of notes similar to a social media feed

items.title: Threads
items.content: Group related notes into connected threads of thought

items.title: Bidirectional Linking
items.content: Create connections between notes to build a knowledge graph

items.title: Search Functionality
items.content: Quickly find notes across your entire collection

items.title: Dark Mode Interface
items.content: Sleek, eye-friendly design with neon pink accents

fullDescription.content: Zettelkasten (German for 'slip box') is a knowledge management and note-taking system created by German sociologist Niklas Luhmann. The method emphasizes creating atomic notes with connections between them, forming a network of ideas that can generate new insights and connections over time.
ZettelTweet modernizes this approach by combining it with familiar social media interfaces, making the method more accessible and engaging for digital natives.

This project was created using v0.dev, Vercel's AI-powered design tool. The entire application was designed and generated through conversational prompts, showcasing how AI can accelerate the development of sophisticated web applications.
